description.value:
You consume fire and hold it until you spit out the flames.

You can ingest a nonmagical fire up to the size of a Small campfire within range. The fire is stored harmlessly in your mouth and dissipates without effect if it is not expelled before the spell ends.

Once ingested, you can spit out the stored fire as an action. If you try to hit a particular target with the flames, treat this as a ranged attack with a range of 5 feet. Small campfire-sized flames deal 2d6 fire damage, while Tiny torch-sized flames deal 1d6 fire damage. Once you have spit out the flames, the fire goes out immediately unless it hits flammable material that can keep it fed.
